results.title: I Remember 1948
results.brief_description:
In Australia’s first bilingual Arabic/English film, four elders give eye-witness accounts of the tumultuous days of Al Nakba, the catastrophe, May 15th, 1948, and its aftermath. As children and young adults, they and their families were among 750,000 Palestinians fleeing for their lives, in the drive to enlarge the recently created State of Israel.

The stories told by these speakers are poignant, unexpected and sometimes surprising, expressing not only the tragedies but also the small miracles which occur in a human catastrophe of such dimensions. Prevented from returning to their homes, the speakers lived as refugees, eventually making their way to Australia. Their continued longing to see their homeland eloquently expresses the feelings of the dispossessed everywhere, and gives this film a universal dimension.

Source: Ballad Films website http://www.balladfilms.com.au/films/i-remember-1948/ [Last accessed 10/01/2023]

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 08]
results.brief_description: A compilation of newsreel segments focusing on Australia. 1. ‘[Royal Melbourne Zoo]’ shows a family strolling through the zoo. 2. ‘[Nar Nar Goon Airport]’ 3. ‘Turtle Island’ includes footage of giant turtles on the beach, men riding the turtles in a light-hearted race, and a dead turtle being cut open to show its heart which continues to beat 48 hours after death. 4. ‘[Peach growing in Australia]’ captures Australia’s fruit growing and canning industry in the 30’s showing the orchards, the sorting and inspection area, women peeling and removing stones, and the mechanised canning and processing sections.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 07]
results.brief_description: A compilation of early silent footage featuring Australian and North American wildlife. Shows kangaroos, wallabies, bandicoots, opossum (including an albino opossum), wombat, koala, Tasmanian devil, platypus and echidna. Also shows footage at a real rodeo in Pendleton, Oregon and a fight betweena cobra and a mongoose.

results.title: [Shetland mills]
results.brief_description: Rare print (not titles/credits) of Shetland Mills woollen factory in Melbourne in the early 1950s. Title and print have been withdrawn and print should only be viewed on a Steenbeck. (HG 20/01/06) Looks at a modern knitting mill in Melbourne circa 1950. Shows headquaters near the corner of Lonsdale and Bourke streets; workers arriving for work; delivering the yarn; lunch in the cafeteria; and workers operating equipment.
